answers.answer: Thanks for stopping by with the good news. One can't hear of this sort of success too often!

Yay for You!!!!  Sorry to hear about about the diabetes.  But SVR is sweet =)I'm debating the PCR thing as well.  If my 6 month post comes back UND......I really want to be done forever.  Or at least the 10 years or so that SVR has shown to last thus far.  But being paranoid, I may just keep having them forever....ARG.Congrats to you!!!!Isobella

Thank you,   I know I guess I will just keep checking it yearly to be sure its still gone.I just hate that I gained back all this weight.    I haven't gained back all that I lost, but a good majority of it, more than I wanted to.I am sure I will get a call next week from the doctor.  I just happened to get my copy today in the mail.   as I always put cc to patient on the remarks on my lab req..     Its never been questioned..   LOL    I am sure will ahve to make an appt to go in and get a script for pills again.   I am sure I have some still ,but they would be over 1 year old.So will wait till I hear from the doctor.     but after reading these things for 48 weeks, I know what I am looking at..  A1C is definately higher than it was while on treatment and my sugar level wasn't a problem anymore.  It says 6.5 for A1C, ( was only like 4.2 last time I had the A1C test.    Triglycerides 197, cholesterol 236,    Chol/Hdlc Ratio 6.1 .. everything else is within normal ranges.    And of course the PCR said <5     I should have had the Quantitative instead, so I could see the words " UNDETECTED "    I will have them do that one next time.    But at least I am SVR , hopefully forever this time.   Although treatment would sure help me lose this weight.. I would never wish to go thru  it again..  Unless of course I have to..   But so far so good.    Fingers crossed for you and for everyone.   Hope you are doing well, and getting back to normal.   Have a great Thanksgiving..  !
this sort of news really a hope for everyone .. really happy for you
Wonderful news! Congratulations!!!
Great news to hear, congrats!!!!
Yay, congrats!!!At least eating less sugar is a lot better than eating all those ribas!
Congrats!!!!Denise
Great news, thanks for sharing...
Two years, that's great!  Congratulations, and wishing you well.jd

Thank you , thank you..  Yes I hope that my words are encouraging to all, and for those that started this wayward journey overweight.. Don't let others get you down about it, It can be done and with success.   I was/am   ( not sure if I have to say "am" anymore ) A1, and did lose the weight on treatment,   ( not the best weight loss program ) but sure worked better than anything else I ever tried to lose weight on.    LOL  And still Slayed the dragon..Heres to everyones success, and Happy thanksgiving to all.    Thanks to all my friends on the forum that helped me on this journey, giving me hope and encouragement to keep going.. as there were times, I did not think I go continue.   But I did and I am Happy to say.  I am done.. Hopefully forever with this virus.   Now I can officially get Life Insurance.. LOL outside of my employer insurance.Dana

Just further cement to close the door on HCV.I've gained weight post treatment also, more weight than I had before and it's not coming off easily.  It doesn't seem natural, the weight that I've gained.  I had actually lost some weight post treatment and suddenly started to gain while not changing physical activity at all. It seems I'm going to have to be more rigorous about it than in the past even because this weight seems stubborn so I'm going to have to be more aggressive about it.  I wish you good luck with that.As for the life insurance thing - interesting.  Alot of people have thought that clearing Hep C wouldn't make any difference however I'm in the process of having my life insurance re-evaluated also.  I was given a policy rating me as a smoker so that I wouldn't have to go through a medical knowing I had Hep C - I've never smoked.  Now that I'm clear, I went back to my insurance company who has agreed to a reassess me as a non-smoker knowing that I had Hep C and have now cleared it - application is in and I'm awaiting results of that.  Good luck with that also.Trish

I was also trying to up my life insurance at work, and also get a policy outside of employer.  They told me that once I am clear 2 years. That I can get the policy. so thats what I have been waiting for.  They can run all the med test they want.  Its not there.. LOL   And I quit smoking a week ago friday.. I would have to have stopped for 1 year and can be listed as a non smoker.  Good luck to you as well.   You may want to have your thyroid tested if you have not already.   That could be your problem with the weight now.   I will have to take medication for it for life now.  I never had a problem with Thyroid before treatment.. was just overweight and had diabetes.  type II, which with the loss of weight was corrected, but now its high again.  and I never really changed my eating habits, still sugar free.. so I don't get it..    So we will see what the doc says when she calls next week.  I know I will have to have an appt to discuss it.   errrr.    at least I got my copy of the labs, so I know what to expect.  Its the SVR that I am ecstatic about.    Feel like having a glass of wine.. LOL but I won't, no reason to start drinking now, with out it for sooo many years now.

I do have thyroid issues as a result of treatment.  I've mentioned the weight concern to my endocrinologist, however he insists that my thyroid dosage is appropriate and suggests I look to lifestyle reasons for my weight gain.  I'm not sure I agree - my lifestyle isn't perfect but I'm far from sedentary.  Some eating habits I can improve and I'll work on that and see if it changes and also hoping to start running again in spite of the joint and muscle pains. Haven't had the time to fit running in without sacrificing squash and I'm not willing to do that, so have been waiting until I can fit both in and I think I'm there, hope so. So I'll see how it goes.  This whole weight thing is quite difficult and I wish you well.
Great news to hear.Congratulations............Hope life is treating you well!

Wonderful!!! Sorry to hear about the diabetes though. Hope you will be able to keep it in check.Here in Denmark they do the last PCR at 1 year. So I guess I will move on after that and not retest again. I think...
Great News!!!!
Fantastic!

Thank you, thank you.  I am going to the dr tomorrow to go over the labs. but I know its the sugar and cholesterol they are going to want to address.Everything else looked find.   I think even TSH was fine, considering I am on meds for it, its in the normal range.. but I still its a bit too slow, or I would not be gaining weight still.Will let you know what the doc says tomorrow.Dana

Congratulations on your 2 years of being clear! That is a great battle to win and a good inspiration for everyone else.Please give as much to your fight against diabetes as you did with Hep C. I helped my 80-something Italian mother change her diet giving up sugar and white flour (she now loves her Kamut grain pasta!). It takes some time to educate yourself and get into the groove of a healthy diet but after some time, it becomes easier.Good luck!

question: Well I just got my lab results from my 2 years pcr test.   Whoooo Hooooo I am officially clear of the nasty treaded virus.  Bad news is that the diabetes is back and going strong.      I will have to really do some changing again in diet.    :(   and lose some of this weight that I gained back.   I must say I feel wonderful, knowing I am clear of the virus, hopefully forever..     Do I still need to get annual test PCR ?Hope everyone is doing well.. Just wanted to stop in and post my great news.
title: 2 years post treatment   - Clear .. whooo hoooo
